items.title: Israel marks 2 years since Oct. 7 attack as Gaza war grinds on
items.standfirst: Israelis are mourning the dead and fearing for the remaining hostages as they mark two years since Hamas‚Äô Oct. 7 attack plunged the region into a devastating war.
items.content: Israelis are mourning the dead and fearing for the remaining hostages as they mark two years since Hamas‚Äô Oct. 7 attack plunged the region into a devastating war.

items.title: These numbers show how 2 years of war have devastated Palestinian lives in Gaza
items.standfirst: It's been two years since Hamas-led militants attacked Israel, killing some 1,200 people and taking 251 hostages. In response, Israeli leaders promised a punishing offensive. Here are some numbers showing the war's toll.
items.content: It's been two years since Hamas-led militants attacked Israel, killing some 1,200 people and taking 251 hostages. In response, Israeli leaders promised a punishing offensive. Here are some numbers showing the war's toll.(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)

items.content: Numbers alone cannot capture the toll the Israel-Hamas war has taken on the Gaza Strip.

items.title: 'I lost so much' - Palestinians reflect on the toll of two years of war in Gaza
items.standfirst: Palestinians have been reflecting on the toll on their lives since Hamas's attack on Israel on 7 October 2023, which triggered the war.
items.content: Palestinians have been reflecting on the toll on their lives since Hamas's attack on Israel on 7 October 2023, which triggered the war.

items.title: Jeremy Bowen: Two years on, will Israel and Hamas seize the chance to end the war?
items.standfirst: There is a chance of a deal that will end the killing and destruction in Gaza and return the Israeli hostages, living and dead, to their families.
items.content: There is a chance of a deal that will end the killing and destruction in Gaza and return the Israeli hostages, living and dead, to their families.

ai_summary: Israel marks two years since the October 7th attack by Hamas, triggering a devastating war.
Palestinians reflect on the war's impact on their lives since the Hamas attack.
The war has devastated Palestinian lives in Gaza, with significant casualties and destruction.
There is a chance of a deal to end the war and return Israeli hostages.
The attack killed around 1,200 people and took 251 hostages.

clusters.title: Everest hikers guided to safety after being stranded by blizzard
clusters.neutral_headline: Hundreds of Hikers Evacuated from Everest Blizzard

items.title: Everest hikers guided to safety after being stranded by blizzard
items.standfirst: Hundreds of hikers have been guided to safety in Tibet after becoming trapped over the weekend by heavy snowfall.
items.content: Hundreds of hikers have been guided to safety in Tibet after becoming trapped over the weekend by heavy snowfall.

items.title: üèîÔ∏è Hundreds of trekkers escape from blizzard-struck Everest in Tibet
items.standfirst: ‚ùÑÔ∏è Hundreds of trekkers stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest in Tibet have been guided to safety by rescuers, Chinese state media reported, as unusually heavy snow and rainfall pummelled the Himalayas. üá®üá≥ Outdoor enthusiasts have flocked to China's rugged interior since an eight-day holiday began on October 1, but a sudden blizzard over the weekend caught off guard hundreds of hikers hoping to catch a glimpse of Everest's Kangshung face. ‚õëÔ∏è Some 350 trekkers have reached the small town of Qudang, while more than 200 trekkers still stranded in freezing temperatures are expected to be evacuated by Tuesday.
items.content: ‚ùÑÔ∏è Hundreds of trekkers stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest in Tibet have been guided to safety by rescuers, Chinese state media reported, as unusually heavy snow and rainfall pummelled the Himalayas. üá®üá≥ Outdoor enthusiasts have flocked to China's rugged interior since an eight-day holiday began on October 1, but a sudden blizzard over the weekend caught off guard hundreds of hikers hoping to catch a glimpse of Everest's Kangshung face. ‚õëÔ∏è Some 350 trekkers have reached the small town of Qudang, while more than 200 trekkers still stranded in freezing temperatures are expected to be evacuated by Tuesday.

items.title: Snowstorm traps hundreds of hikers on Mount Everest during China's national holiday
items.standfirst: Heavy snow trapped hundreds of hikers on Mount Everest‚Äôs Tibetan side, with about 350 hikers safe at a meeting point and rescuers contacting another 200. The hikers were stranded at around 4,900 meters elevation, and rescue efforts were ongoing.
items.content: Heavy snow trapped hundreds of hikers on Mount Everest‚Äôs Tibetan side, with about 350 hikers safe at a meeting point and rescuers contacting another 200. The hikers were stranded at around 4,900 meters elevation, and rescue efforts were ongoing.

items.content: More than 200 people left stranded by a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest are being evacuated, Reuters news agency reports.

items.content: At least one hiker has died and hundreds are still stranded near the mountain's eastern face.

clusters.title: Time may be running out for Master of clocks Macron: What next for France?
clusters.neutral_headline: Macron Faces Pressure Amid French Political Crisis

items.title: Time may be running out for Master of clocks Macron: What next for France?
items.standfirst: After eight years in office, Emmanuel Macron's position as president is coming under increasing pressure as France's political crisis escalates.
items.content: After eight years in office, Emmanuel Macron's position as president is coming under increasing pressure as France's political crisis escalates.

items.title: Former PM and Macron ally √âdouard Philippe joins calls for president's resignation
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron's first and longest-serving prime minister, √âdouard Philippe, urged him to resign on Monday, suggesting that polls should be held early once a budget is passed. The appeal came a day after S√©bastien Lecornu, France‚Äôs latest prime minister, resigned less than a month after being appointed, deepening the political crisis.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron's first and longest-serving prime minister, √âdouard Philippe, urged him to resign on Monday, suggesting that polls should be held early once a budget is passed. The appeal came a day after S√©bastien Lecornu, France‚Äôs latest prime minister, resigned less than a month after being appointed, deepening the political crisis.

items.title: Macron under pressure to call snap parliamentary elections or resign
items.standfirst: French president‚Äôs former allies join opponents in demanding he act to end a spiralling political crisisFrance‚Äôs president, Emmanuel Macron, is under intense pressure to call snap parliamentary elections or resign as former allies join his opponents in demanding he act to end a spiralling political crisis in the EU‚Äôs second biggest economy.Macron‚Äôs first prime minister on Tuesday urged the president to step down amid mounting frustration even within the president‚Äôs own camp over one of the worst spells of political chaos in France since the foundation of its Fifth Republic in 1958. Continue reading...
items.content: French president‚Äôs former allies join opponents in demanding he act to end a spiralling political crisisFrance‚Äôs president, Emmanuel Macron, is under intense pressure to call snap parliamentary elections or resign as former allies join his opponents in demanding he act to end a spiralling political crisis in the EU‚Äôs second biggest economy.Macron‚Äôs first prime minister on Tuesday urged the president to step down amid mounting frustration even within the president‚Äôs own camp over one of the worst spells of political chaos in France since the foundation of its Fifth Republic in 1958. Continue reading...

items.title: France‚Äôs opposition pressures Emmanuel Macron amid political crisis
items.standfirst: France is facing a deep political crisis as Prime Minister S√©bastien Lecornu resigned just 27 days into his term, marking the fifth PM to quit in under two years. Opposition parties are demanding President Macron‚Äôs resignation or snap elections, but Macron insists he will finish his term despite growing public and political pressure, as FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali explains from the National Assembly.
items.content: France is facing a deep political crisis as Prime Minister S√©bastien Lecornu resigned just 27 days into his term, marking the fifth PM to quit in under two years. Opposition parties are demanding President Macron‚Äôs resignation or snap elections, but Macron insists he will finish his term despite growing public and political pressure, as FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali explains from the National Assembly.

items.title: France's PM quits hours after naming government, plunging the country into more political chaos
items.standfirst: French Prime Minister S√©bastien Lecornu resigned after less than a month in office on Monday and less than 24 hours after naming a new government that prompted a key coalition ally to withdraw support. The move deepened the country‚Äôs political crisis and left President Emmanuel Macron with few options. The presidency said that Macron, who has been hitting record lows in opinion polls, accepted the resignation.
items.content: French Prime Minister S√©bastien Lecornu resigned after less than a month in office on Monday and less than 24 hours after naming a new government that prompted a key coalition ally to withdraw support. The move deepened the country‚Äôs political crisis and left President Emmanuel Macron with few options. The presidency said that Macron, who has been hitting record lows in opinion polls, accepted the resignation.

items.title: How can France overcome its political crisis?
items.standfirst: France‚Äôs President Emmanuel Macron faces increasing calls to resign or call snap elections amid political chaos that has seen five prime ministers resign in under two years. Despite the pressure, Macron insists he will complete his term ending in 2027. Meanwhile, outgoing Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu is trying to form a new government, while former Prime Minister Edouard Philippe urges for new leadership to resolve the deadlock. FRANCE 24's international editor Philip Turle has the analysis.
items.content: France‚Äôs President Emmanuel Macron faces increasing calls to resign or call snap elections amid political chaos that has seen five prime ministers resign in under two years. Despite the pressure, Macron insists he will complete his term ending in 2027. Meanwhile, outgoing Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu is trying to form a new government, while former Prime Minister Edouard Philippe urges for new leadership to resolve the deadlock. FRANCE 24's international editor Philip Turle has the analysis.

items.title: Macron ally calls on French president to quit early

items.content: Former prime minister Edouard Philippe urges head of state to bring forward 2027 elections

items.title: France is in crisis but bond markets leave other governments at risk of meltdown too
items.standfirst: Investors rattled by resignation of French PM but country is not alone in trying to grapple with political mathsMacron asks outgoing French PM to make last-ditch effort to avoid political crisisWhat happened on a chaotic day in French politics ‚Äì and what next?S√©bastien Lecornu‚Äôs abrupt resignation as the French prime minister on Monday after less than a month in the role marked the latest clash between France‚Äôs stretched public finances and its polarised politics.Lecornu was the latest prime minister to try and fail to cobble together a package of spending cuts and tax rises that would pass muster in a parliament without a clear majority, and contain mounting bond market pressures. Continue reading...
items.content: Investors rattled by resignation of French PM but country is not alone in trying to grapple with political mathsMacron asks outgoing French PM to make last-ditch effort to avoid political crisisWhat happened on a chaotic day in French politics ‚Äì and what next?S√©bastien Lecornu‚Äôs abrupt resignation as the French prime minister on Monday after less than a month in the role marked the latest clash between France‚Äôs stretched public finances and its polarised politics.Lecornu was the latest prime minister to try and fail to cobble together a package of spending cuts and tax rises that would pass muster in a parliament without a clear majority, and contain mounting bond market pressures. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Emmanuel Macron's position as president is under increasing pressure.
Former Prime Minister √âdouard Philippe urged Macron to resign.
Opposition parties are demanding Macron's resignation or snap elections.
The political crisis has deepened, with the fifth PM quitting in two years.
Macron insists he will finish his term despite growing pressure.

items.title: Israel marks two-year anniversary of October 7 attack without national commemoration
items.standfirst: Israel marks the second anniversary of the October 7, 2023 attack on Tuesday, as Hamas and Israeli negotiators hold indirect talks to end the two-year war in Gaza under a US-proposed peace plan. But as FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky explains, the Israeli government didn't plan national commemorations this year.
items.content: Israel marks the second anniversary of the October 7, 2023 attack on Tuesday, as Hamas and Israeli negotiators hold indirect talks to end the two-year war in Gaza under a US-proposed peace plan. But as FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky explains, the Israeli government didn't plan national commemorations this year.

items.title: Israelis gather to mark two years since 7 October Hamas attack that killed 1,200
items.standfirst: Commemorations held in kibbutzim whose members were killed or kidnapped as Tel Aviv rally to call for hostages‚Äô releaseIsraelis gathered across the country on Tuesday to mark the second anniversary of the 7 October attack, in which Hamas-led militants killed about 1,200 people and took 251 hostages during an assault on southern Israel.Unofficial commemorations were held in the small kibbutzim of southern Israel whose members were killed or kidnapped, and a large rally was due to be held in Tel Aviv to call for the release of the remaining hostages from Hamas captivity in Gaza. Continue reading...

clusters.title: US: Shutdown crisis deepens after Senate rejects spending plans
clusters.neutral_headline: US Government Shutdown Continues After Senate Rejects Measures

items.title: US: Shutdown crisis deepens after Senate rejects spending plans
items.standfirst: The Senate has failed for the fifth time to pass spending measures needed to reopen the government. Both Democratic and Republican proposals were rejected, falling short of the 60-vote threshold. Meanwhile, Donald Trump reiterated threats of mass layoffs if the impasse continues, as thousands of federal employees remain furloughed or working without pay.
items.content: The Senate has failed for the fifth time to pass spending measures needed to reopen the government. Both Democratic and Republican proposals were rejected, falling short of the 60-vote threshold. Meanwhile, Donald Trump reiterated threats of mass layoffs if the impasse continues, as thousands of federal employees remain furloughed or working without pay.

items.title: US shutdown to continue after funding measures fail again in Senate
